newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani authorities seize 476 kg of hashish.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani authorities seize 476 kg of hashish.

text.p: Pakistani authorities said on Thursday they had seized 476 kg (1,047 pounds) of hashish and an unspecified quantity of opium at a police check post in North West Frontier Province (NWFP).
A statement by the Anti-Narcotics Force said the seizure followed a tip-off that the drugs were on a brick truck that would enter Punjab province from Kohat in NWFP.
The truck was intercepted at Kotal check post, about 40 km (25 miles) west of the NWFP provincial capital Peshawar, on Wednesday night. The driver and his assistant were arrested.
Smugglers use Pakistan's tribal border areas in NWFP and the southwestern province of Baluchistan as transit routes for opium and hashish produced in neighbouring Afghanistan.
